title: Self-Efficacy-Based e-Learning Course for Integrated Physical Education for Students with Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of secondary physical education and understanding of disabilities
context.additional_context: For general citizens needing practical competencies in inclusive education for people with disabilities. Cultivates field applicability through theoretical knowledge and self-efficacy enhancement.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more adaptive instructional strategies to support the participation of students with disabilities in physical education classes
Learners can design integrated physical education lesson plans applying self-efficacy theory (mastery experiences, vicarious experiences, and social persuasion)
Learners can resolve five or more potential problem situations when interacting with students with disabilities in both online and offline environments

resources: LMS Platform (Video, Quiz, Discussion Board Features)
Database of physical activity examples by disability type

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
